intro: Hariota gracilis, commonly known as the slender hariota, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals, and are arranged in clusters. Hariota gracilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
